title: Inclusion map
summary: In mathematics, if A {\displaystyle A} is a subset of B , {\displaystyle B,} then the inclusion map (also inclusion function, insertion,[1] or canonical injection) is the function Î¹ {\displaystyle \iota } that sends each element x {\displaystyle x} of A {\displaystyle A} to x , {\displaystyle x,} treated as an element of B : {\displaystyle B:}
